page.title: 16 Change since 1945
page.content: Since 1945 mains water,sewerage and electricity have been connected to most houses and Polstead's only street light erected.Residents in their forties remember evenings by the light of an oil lamp,and carrying pails of water from the pump on the Hill,taken away in 1955,and now the site of the 'phone box.Trees have been planted on the village green.The Methodist church at the Heath closed in 1985 and has been sold.Twenty five council houses were built in Rockalls road,and some sold to the tenants.Large building plots have been split up,and a lot of "infilling" has taken place.Two Eastern Counties 'buses no longer call at the village.Not long ago the milk was brought by Mr Knott in big churns on a horse cart.The cycle shop has gone from the village green.
